definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: He feinted with his left hand and hit me with his right.
sentences.chinese: 他用左手做了一個假動作，用右手打到了我。

sentences.english: I ran into a problem with this because shooting and pump faking are tied to the same controller movement.
sentences.chinese: 我遇到一個問題，投籃和假動作上籃都是一個操作。

sentences.english: Love is like playing basketball, with defence, offence and even tricks .
sentences.chinese: 戀愛就像打籃球，有防守，有進攻，偶爾也假動作。

sentences.english: If you're good enough, and with Precision Dribbling you can dribble through teams.
sentences.chinese: 你能用梅西盤過一整支球隊嗎？不用假動作，光帶球。

definition: to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
to open fire/to shoot a gun
to mess sth up/to screw up
the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
lit. like a sheet of loose sand/fig. unable to cooperate (idiom)
